quotes: scrap the plan to have nuclear power contribute 53 percent (of electricity supply) by 2030 and reduce the degree of reliance on nuclear power,
In August, Kan removed three of Japan's top nuclear energy officials in effort to break ties between government and the atomic industry.
When interviewed in 2012, after resigning as prime minister, Kan said the Fukushima accident made it clear to him that 'Japan needs to dramatically reduce its dependence on nuclear power'
Kan announced his intention to resign on 10 August 2011.
On 26 August, with passage of a debt bill and the renewable energy bill as final conditions, Kan expected 'to see his successor in office [within the] week'
